On Sat, Jan 25, 2003 at 11:54:54AM -0800, S. Mike Dierken wrote:
> 
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Vincent D.Murphy" <vdm@...>
> 
> > > For example if I remember correctly
> > > HTML forms can only submit POST and GET requests,
> >
> > correct.
> Pedantically, HTML FORM can have method='PUT' - it's the client (i.e.
> browser) that does or does not recognize it.

HTML 4.01 defines (S17.3) "get" and "post" as the only valid values for
the method attribute of the form tag. The browsers don't recognise it
because there is no valid way to construct a PUT or DELETE form in HTML.

Ian
<ian@...>
